metadata.description: The location into which regionally scoped resources should be deployed. Note that Front Door is a global resource.
The IP address prefix (CIDR range) to use when deploying the virtual network.
The SKU of the API Management instance.
The IP address prefix (CIDR range) to use when deploying the API Management subnet within the virtual network.
The name of the API publisher. This information is used by API Management.
The email address of the API publisher. This information is used by API Management.
Provide Key 1 for the Azure Open AI service.
Provide the URL of the Azure Open AI service.
Provide the Public IP address of the Azure Open AI service.
The location into which the virtual network resources should be deployed.
The IP address prefix (CIDR range) to use when deploying the virtual network.
The IP address prefix (CIDR range) to use when deploying the API Management subnet within the virtual network.

properties.description: APIM service dependency on Azure Blob and Azure Table Storage
Connect to Azure Active Directory for Developer Portal Authentication or for Oauth2 flow during any Proxy Authentication
Allow APIM service control plane access to KeyVault to refresh secrets

metadata.description: The location into which the API Management resources should be deployed.
The name of the API Management service instance to create. This must be globally unique.
The name of the API publisher. This information is used by API Management.
The email address of the API publisher. This information is used by API Management.
The name of the SKU to use when creating the API Management service instance. This must be a SKU that supports virtual network integration.
The number of worker instances of your API Management service that should be provisioned.
Specifies the name of the key vault.
Specifies the Azure location where the key vault should be created.
Specifies whether Azure Virtual Machines are permitted to retrieve certificates stored as secrets from the key vault.
Specifies whether Azure Disk Encryption is permitted to retrieve secrets from the vault and unwrap keys.
Specifies whether Azure Resource Manager is permitted to retrieve secrets from the key vault.
Specifies the Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be used for authenticating requests to the key vault. Get it by using Get-AzSubscription cmdlet.

Specifies the object ID of a user, service principal or security group in the Azure Active Directory tenant for the vault. The object ID must be unique for the list of access policies. Get it by using Get-AzADUser or Get-AzADServicePrincipal cmdlets.

Specifies the permissions to keys in the vault. Valid values are: all, encrypt, decrypt, wrapKey, unwrapKey, sign, verify, get, list, create, update, import, delete, backup, restore, recover, and purge.
Specifies the permissions to secrets in the vault. Valid values are: all, get, list, set, delete, backup, restore, recover, and purge.
Specifies the name of the secret that you want to create.
Specifies the value of the secret that you want to create.
